span.span: It is the mission of the Cedar Cliff Local School District to:Â Provide students with the best well-rounded education that teaches, challenges and develops the mind, body and character and prepares responsible graduates who contribute within society. Â

div.span: Â Â Â We are glad you are visiting our site.Â Feel free to peruse the information as well as check out the promotional video created by our CHS students highlighting our district and community.Â I am sure you will agree, Cedar Cliff Local Schools are the perfect place to educate your child! span.strong: Know a child that you suspect has a disability?

span.span: Ohio school districts are required to provide interventions when school-age students are experiencing difficulties or post where ADA complaints are to be filed. Â As a result,Â parents or educators may suspect a disability and referrals can be made for evaluations which are free of charge and will determi
ne if a child living in the district has a disability or if a civil complaint procedure is deemed necessary. Â

div.font:
Notice to individuals with disabilities:
â

If you or your child has a disability that limits your web experience, and our site does not meet your needs, please email our district webmaster at:Â ayake@ccliff.netÂ and we will do our best to address your concerns. You may also call Mr. Cris Sidell, Technology Coordinator, to discuss any issues at 937-766-6000 ext. 2101. If you would like to file a more formal complaint in regards to Section 504 and/or the A.D.A., you mayÂ contact our district Special Education Supervisor, Mary Ann Fenwick, atÂ mfenwick@ccliff.netÂ or 937-766-6000 ext. 1172.

br.font: The Cedar Cliff Local School District makes every effort to verify that all links are operational and all information is accurate, appropriate, and of high quality. The District expects that these standards are met. However, the viability of links that are not created through our District cannot be guaranteed.Â
